intro: Acrophorus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acrophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
